required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sipuleucel-T as Neoadjuvant Treatment in Prostate Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label, Phase 2 Trial of Immunotherapy With Sipuleucel-T (Provenge®) as Neoadjuvant Treatment in Men With Localized Prostate Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open label, Phase 2 trial of immunotherapy with sipuleucel-T as neoadjuvant treatment in men with localized prostate cancer.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a single center, open label, Phase 2 study. Subjects will be treated with 3 infusions of sipuleucel-T prior to a scheduled radical prostatectomy (RP) surgery. To assess the immune response following treatment with sipuleucel-T, tissue from the prostatectomy specimen will be compared with tissue from the core biopsy specimen obtained prior to treatment with sipuleucel T. Following RP, subjects will be randomized to receive either a booster infusion of sipuleucel T or no further treatment with sipuleucel-T (i.e., booster: no booster).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the Number of Infiltrating CD3+ T Cells Within the Prostate Tissue Between the Biopsy and the Post-RP Tissue Specimens in Each Subject
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-treatment biopsy (baseline) and post-RP (12 weeks post-treatment)
primary_outcome.description: CD3+ T cell infiltration within prostate tissue was quantified using immunohistochemistry (IHC) staining techniques. Cells were enumerated per unit area (cells/μm2). For post-RP tissue specimens, three areas of interest were identified: Benign tissue, tumor tissue, and tumor interface tissue.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Number of Infiltrating CD4+ T Cells Within the Prostate Tissue Between the Biopsy and the Post-RP Tissue Specimens in Each Subject
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-treatment biopsy (baseline) and post-RP (12 weeks post-treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: CD4+ T cell infiltration within prostate tissue was quantified using immunohistochemistry (IHC) staining techniques. Cells were enumerated per unit area (cells/μm2). For post-RP tissue specimens, three areas of interest were identified: Benign tissue, tumor tissue, and tumor interface tissue.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Number of Infiltrating CD8+ T Cells Within the Prostate Tissue Between the Biopsy and the Post-RP Tissue Specimens in Each Subject
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-treatment biopsy (baseline) and post-RP (12 weeks following sipuleucel-T)
secondary_outcome.description: CD8+ T cell infiltration within prostate tissue was quantified using immunohistochemistry (IHC) staining techniques. Cells were enumerated per unit area (cells/μm2). For post-RP tissue specimens, three areas of interest were identified: Benign tissue, tumor tissue, and tumor interface tissue.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Antigen PA2024-specific T Cell Immunity in Peripheral Blood
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (screening visit) and up to 12-weeks post-RP visit (24 weeks following sipuleucel-T)
secondary_outcome.description: Antigen PA2024-specific T cell immune response is measured using interferon gamma (IFN-γ) enzyme-linked immunospot (ELISPOT) assays. This analysis was performed as previously described in Fong L et al. (J Immunol. 2001;167(12):7150-7156.). The unit of analysis is the number of IFN-γ ELISPOT counts per 300,000 peripheral blood mononuclear cells.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Antigen PAP-specific T Cell Immunity in Peripheral Blood
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (screening visit) and up to 12-weeks post-RP visit (24 months post sipuleucel-T)
secondary_outcome.description: Antigen PAP-specific T cell immune response is measured using interferon gamma (IFN-γ) enzyme-linked immunospot (ELISPOT) assays. PAP = Prostatic Acid Phosphatase.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of a Post-RP Booster Infusion of Sipuleucel-T Over Time of Antigen PA2024-Specific T Cell Immunity in the Peripheral Blood.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 Weeks Post-RP (Pre-booster) and up to 72 Weeks post-RP
secondary_outcome.description: The number of PA2024-specific T cells was enumerated by interferon gamma (IFN-γ) enzyme-linked immunospot (ELISPOT) assays (memory T cells).

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of a Post-RP Booster Infusion of Sipuleucel-T Over Time of Antigen PAP-Specific T Cell Immunity in the Peripheral Blood.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 Weeks Post-RP (Pre-booster) and up to 72 Weeks post-RP
secondary_outcome.description: The number of PAP-specific T cells was enumerated by interferon gamma (IFN-γ) enzyme-linked immunospot (ELISPOT) assays (memory T cells). PAP = Prostatic Acid Phosphatase.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of Booster Effect in Antigen PA2024-Specific T Cell Immunity Over Time Between the Two Randomized Groups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 Weeks Post-RP (Pre-booster) and up to 72 Weeks post-RP
secondary_outcome.description: The number of Antigen PA2024-specific T cells was enumerated by interferon gamma (IFN-γ) enzyme-linked immunospot (ELISPOT) assays (memory T cells). The two groups were compared in the statistical model are: Randomized to Booster and Randomized to No Booster.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of Booster Effect in Antigen PAP-Specific T Cell Immunity Over Time Between the Two Randomized Groups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 Weeks Post-RP (Pre-booster) and up to 72 Weeks post-RP
secondary_outcome.description: The number of Antigen PAP-specific T cells was enumerated by interferon gamma (IFN-γ) enzyme-linked immunospot (ELISPOT) assays (memory T cells). The two groups were compared in the statistical model are: Randomized to Booster and Randomized to No Booster. PAP = Prostatic Acid Phosphatase.

arm_group.description: Subjects were to receive 3 infusions of sipuleucel-T 12 weeks prior to RP, and then an additional booster infusion 13 weeks following RP.
Subjects were to receive 3 infusions of sipuleucel-T 12 weeks prior to RP, with no further sipuleucel-T treatment.

intervention.description: Sipuleucel-T is an autologous active cellular immunotherapy product designed to stimulate an immune response against prostate cancer. Sipuleucel-T consists of autologous peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs), including antigen presenting cells (APCs), that have been activated in vitro with a recombinant fusion protein.

Sipuleucel-T is an autologous active cellular immunotherapy product designed to stimulate an immune response against prostate cancer. Sipuleucel-T consists of autologous peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs), including antigen presenting cells (APCs), that have been activated in vitro with a recombinant fusion protein.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adenocarcinoma of the prostate.
- Subject is scheduled for RP as the initial therapy for localized prostate cancer.
- Subject is ≥ 18 years of age.
- Subject has an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0 or 1.
- Subject has adequate hematologic, renal, and liver function.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject has any evidence of metastasis.
- Subject received hormones, including luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone agonists, antiandrogens, or 5 α-reductase inhibitors at any time prior to study screening.
- Subject has received prior radiation therapy or chemotherapy for prostate cancer.
- Subject has received systemic steroid therapy within 14 days.
- Subject has a history of stage III or greater cancer, excluding prostate cancer.
- Subjects with a history of basal or squamous cell skin cancers are allowed, provided that the subject was adequately treated and is disease-free at the time of study screening.
- Subjects with a history of stage I or II cancer must have been adequately treated and been disease-free for ≥ 3 years prior to study screening.

facility.name: University of Utah School of Medicine

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted across 6 sites in the US. Screening and enrollment occurred from Sept 2008 - Dec 2012. 42 subjects were registered. 41 subjects received at least 1 sipuleucel-T infusion prior to radical prostatectomr (RP),18 subjects were randomized to the booster group,15 were randomized to the no booster group; and 8 were not randomized.

group.title: Sipuleucel-T With Booster
group.description: Subjects were to receive 3 infusions of sipuleucel-T 12 weeks prior to RP, and then an additional booster infusion 13 weeks following RP.

group.title: Sipuleucel-T Without Booster
group.description: Subjects were to receive 3 infusions of sipuleucel-T 12 weeks prior to RP, with no further sipuleucel-T treatment.

group.title: Sipuleucel-T Without Randomization to Booster
group.description: Subjects were to receive 3 infusions of sipuleucel-T 12 weeks prior to RP, and declined participation in the post-RP booster phase (received no further sipuleucel-T treatment).

group.title: Sipuleucel-T With Booster
group.description: Subjects received 3 infusions of sipuleucel-T 12 weeks prior to RP, and then an additional booster infusion 13 weeks following RP.

group.title: Sipuleucel-T Without Booster
group.description: Subjects received 3 infusions of sipuleucel-T 12 weeks prior to RP, with no further sipuleucel-T treatment.

group.title: Sipuleucel-T Without Randomization to Booster
group.description: Subjects received 3 infusions of sipuleucel-T 12 weeks prior to RP, and declined participation in the post-RP booster phase(received no further sipuleucel-T treatment).

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change in the Number of Infiltrating CD3+ T Cells Within the Prostate Tissue Between the Biopsy and the Post-RP Tissue Specimens in Each Subject
outcome.description: CD3+ T cell infiltration within prostate tissue was quantified using immunohistochemistry (IHC) staining techniques. Cells were enumerated per unit area (cells/μm2). For post-RP tissue specimens, three areas of interest were identified: Benign tissue, tumor tissue, and tumor interface tissue.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-treatment biopsy (baseline) and post-RP (12 weeks post-treatment)
outcome.population: All subjects who received at least 1 infusion of sipuleucel-T and underwent subsequent RP. Results are not presented by arm because all assessments were performed prior to randomization to booster.

group.title: Biopsy Benign Tissue
group.description: Tissue from the core biopsy specimen obtained prior to treatment with sipuleucel-T

group.title: Post-RP Benign Tissue
group.description: Benign tissue from post-treatment with sipuleucel-T and post-RP

group.title: Post-RP Tumor Tissue
group.description: Tumor tissue from post-treatment with sipuleucel-T and post-RP

group.title: Post-RP Tumor Interface
group.description: Tumor interface (the junction of normal and malignant) tissue from post-treatment with sipuleucel-T and post-RP

measure.title: Change in the Number of Infiltrating CD3+ T Cells Within the Prostate Tissue Between the Biopsy and the Post-RP Tissue Specimens in Each Subject
measure.description: CD3+ T cell infiltration within prostate tissue was quantified using immunohistochemistry (IHC) staining techniques. Cells were enumerated per unit area (cells/μm2). For post-RP tissue specimens, three areas of interest were identified: Benign tissue, tumor tissue, and tumor interface tissue.
measure.population: All subjects who received at least 1 infusion of sipuleucel-T and underwent subsequent RP. Results are not presented by arm because all assessments were performed prior to randomization to booster.

analysis.groups_desc: A 2-fold increase in CD3+ T cell counts from biopsy to post-RP was considered a positive response. The number of infiltrating CD3+ T cells/μm2 was coded as binary with each subject categorized as having at least a 2-fold increase from baseline or not. One sample Chi-square test for a binary response, with a null hypothesis of 15% was implemented. The tests were done using post-treatment post-RP benign tissue, tumor tissue, and tumor interface compared to the biopsy benign tissue.
analysis.p_value_desc: Bonferroni-adjusted p-values will be reported to alleviate the multiple testing problem; pbon = minimum of p*3 and 1 (p = the nominal p-value from the test, pbon = the Bonferroni-adjusted p-value). Confidence intervals will be adjusted similarly.

analysis.groups_desc: A 2-fold increase in CD3+ T cell counts from biopsy to post-RP was considered a positive response. The number of infiltrating CD3+ T cells/μm2 was coded as binary with each subject categorized as having at least a 2-fold increase from baseline or not. One sample Chi-square test for a binary response, with a null hypothesis of 15% was implemented. The tests were done using post-treatment post-RP benign tissue, tumor tissue, and tumor interface compared to the biopsy benign tissue.
analysis.p_value_desc: Bonferroni-adjusted p-values will be reported to alleviate the multiple testing problem; pbon = minimum of p*3 and 1 (p = the nominal p-value from the test, pbon = the Bonferroni-adjusted p-value). Confidence intervals will be adjusted similarly.

outcome.title: Change in Antigen PA2024-specific T Cell Immunity in Peripheral Blood
outcome.description: Antigen PA2024-specific T cell immune response is measured using interferon gamma (IFN-γ) enzyme-linked immunospot (ELISPOT) assays. This analysis was performed as previously described in Fong L et al. (J Immunol. 2001;167(12):7150–7156.). The unit of analysis is the number of IFN-γ ELISPOT counts per 300,000 peripheral blood mononuclear cells.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (screening visit) and up to 12-weeks post-RP visit (24 weeks following sipuleucel-T)
outcome.population: All subjects who received at least 1 infusion of sipuleucel-T and underwent subsequent RP. Results are not presented by arm because all assessments were performed prior to randomization to booster.

group.title: Baseline
group.description: ELISPOT for PA2024 at baseline

group.title: Pre-RP Visit
group.description: ELISPOT for PA2024 at Pre-RP Visit

group.title: 6 Weeks Post-RP
group.description: ELISPOT for PA2024 at 6 Weeks post-RP

group.title: 12 Weeks Post-RP
group.description: ELISPOT for PA2024 at 12 Weeks post-RP

measure.title: Change in Antigen PA2024-specific T Cell Immunity in Peripheral Blood
measure.description: Antigen PA2024-specific T cell immune response is measured using interferon gamma (IFN-γ) enzyme-linked immunospot (ELISPOT) assays. This analysis was performed as previously described in Fong L et al. (J Immunol. 2001;167(12):7150–7156.). The unit of analysis is the number of IFN-γ ELISPOT counts per 300,000 peripheral blood mononuclear cells.
measure.population: All subjects who received at least 1 infusion of sipuleucel-T and underwent subsequent RP. Results are not presented by arm because all assessments were performed prior to randomization to booster.

analysis.groups_desc: The change over time was evaluated by using repeated measure analysis of variance (ANOVA) methods with a mixed model approach. The ranked data were used in the statistical model.
analysis.p_value_desc: P value is for the visit effect in the mixed model
analysis.method_desc: Randomization groups, visits (up to 12-weeks Post-RP), and randomization groups × visits interaction were included in the mixed model.

outcome.population: All subjects who received at least 1 infusion of sipuleucel-T and underwent subsequent RP. Results are not presented by arm because all assessments were performed prior to randomization to booster.

group.title: Baseline
group.description: ELISPOT for PAP at baseline

group.title: Pre-RP Visit
group.description: ELISPOT for PAP at pre-RP visit

group.description: ELISPOT for PAP at 12 Weeks post-RP

measure.title: Change in Antigen PAP-specific T Cell Immunity in Peripheral Blood
measure.description: Antigen PAP-specific T cell immune response is measured using interferon gamma (IFN-γ) enzyme-linked immunospot (ELISPOT) assays. PAP = Prostatic Acid Phosphatase.
measure.population: All subjects who received at least 1 infusion of sipuleucel-T and underwent subsequent RP. Results are not presented by arm because all assessments were performed prior to randomization to booster.

analysis.groups_desc: Repeated measure analysis of variance (ANOVA) methods with a mixed model approach was used. The ranked data were used in the statistical model.
analysis.p_value_desc: P value is for the visit effect in the mixed model
analysis.method_desc: Randomization groups, visits (up to 12-weeks Post-RP), and randomization groups × visits interaction were included in the mixed model.

outcome.title: Effect of a Post-RP Booster Infusion of Sipuleucel-T Over Time of Antigen PA2024-Specific T Cell Immunity in the Peripheral Blood.
outcome.description: The number of PA2024-specific T cells was enumerated by interferon gamma (IFN-γ) enzyme-linked immunospot (ELISPOT) assays (memory T cells).
outcome.time_frame: 12 Weeks Post-RP (Pre-booster) and up to 72 Weeks post-RP
outcome.population: Subjects received at least 1 infusion of sipuleucel-T, were randomized to receive a booster, and had blood samples suitable for ELISPOT analysis.

group.title: 12 Weeks Post-RP/Pre-Booster
group.description: ELISPOT for PA2024 measured at 12 Weeks Post-RP/Pre-Booster for subjects randomized to booster

group.title: 24 Weeks Post-RP
group.description: ELISPOT for PA2024 measured at 24 Weeks Post-RP for subjects randomized to booster

group.title: 48 Weeks Post-RP
group.description: ELISPOT for PA2024 measured at 48 Weeks Post-RP for subjects randomized to booster

group.title: 72 Weeks Post-RP
group.description: ELISPOT for PA2024 measured at 72 Weeks Post-RP for subjects randomized to booster

measure.title: Effect of a Post-RP Booster Infusion of Sipuleucel-T Over Time of Antigen PA2024-Specific T Cell Immunity in the Peripheral Blood.
measure.description: The number of PA2024-specific T cells was enumerated by interferon gamma (IFN-γ) enzyme-linked immunospot (ELISPOT) assays (memory T cells).
measure.population: Subjects received at least 1 infusion of sipuleucel-T, were randomized to receive a booster, and had blood samples suitable for ELISPOT analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: The change over time was evaluated by using repeated measure analysis of variance (ANOVA) methods with a mixed model approach to allow for a varying number of follow-up measurements. The ranked data were used in the statistical model.
analysis.p_value_desc: P value compares 24 week post-RP to pre-booster (12 weeks post RP)

analysis.groups_desc: The change over time was evaluated by using repeated measure analysis of variance (ANOVA) methods with a mixed model approach to allow for a varying number of follow-up measurements. The ranked data were used in the statistical model.
analysis.p_value_desc: P value compares 48 week post-RP to pre-booster (12 weeks post RP)

analysis.groups_desc: The change over time was evaluated by using repeated measure analysis of variance (ANOVA) methods with a mixed model approach to allow for a varying number of follow-up measurements. The ranked data were used in the statistical model.
analysis.p_value_desc: P value compares 72 week post-RP to pre-booster (12 weeks post RP)

outcome.title: Effect of a Post-RP Booster Infusion of Sipuleucel-T Over Time of Antigen PAP-Specific T Cell Immunity in the Peripheral Blood.
outcome.description: The number of PAP-specific T cells was enumerated by interferon gamma (IFN-γ) enzyme-linked immunospot (ELISPOT) assays (memory T cells). PAP = Prostatic Acid Phosphatase.
outcome.time_frame: 12 Weeks Post-RP (Pre-booster) and up to 72 Weeks post-RP
outcome.population: Subjects received at least 1 infusion of sipuleucel-T, were randomized to receive a booster, and had blood samples suitable for ELISPOT analysis.

outcome.title: Comparison of Booster Effect in Antigen PA2024-Specific T Cell Immunity Over Time Between the Two Randomized Groups
outcome.description: The number of Antigen PA2024-specific T cells was enumerated by interferon gamma (IFN-γ) enzyme-linked immunospot (ELISPOT) assays (memory T cells). The two groups were compared in the statistical model are: Randomized to Booster and Randomized to No Booster.
outcome.time_frame: 12 Weeks Post-RP (Pre-booster) and up to 72 Weeks post-RP
outcome.population: Subjects received at least 1 infusion of sipuleucel-T, were randomized to receive either a booster infusion or no further treatment following RP, and had blood samples suitable for ELISPOT analysis.

group.title: Booster: 12 Weeks Post-RP/Pre-Booster
group.description: ELISPOT for PA2024 measured at 12 Weeks Post-RP/Pre-Booster for subjects randomized to booster

group.title: No Booster: 12 Weeks Post-RP/Pre-Booster
group.description: ELISPOT for PA2024 measured at 12 Weeks Post-RP/Pre-Booster for subjects randomized to no booster

group.title: Booster: 24 Weeks Post-RP
group.description: ELISPOT for PA2024 measured at 24 Weeks Post-RP for subjects randomized to booster

group.title: No Booster: 24 Weeks Post-RP
group.description: ELISPOT for PA2024 measured at 24 Weeks Post-RP for subjects randomized to no booster

group.title: Booster: 48 Weeks Post-RP
group.description: ELISPOT for PA2024 measured at 48 Weeks Post-RP for subjects randomized to booster

group.title: No Booster: 48 Weeks Post-RP
group.description: ELISPOT for PA2024 measured at 48 Weeks Post-RP for subjects randomized to no booster

group.title: Booster: 72 Weeks Post-RP
group.description: ELISPOT for PA2024 measured at 72 Weeks Post-RP for subjects randomized to booster

group.title: No Booster: 72 Weeks Post-RP
group.description: ELISPOT for PA2024 measured at 72 Weeks Post-RP for subjects randomized to no booster

measure.title: Comparison of Booster Effect in Antigen PA2024-Specific T Cell Immunity Over Time Between the Two Randomized Groups
measure.description: The number of Antigen PA2024-specific T cells was enumerated by interferon gamma (IFN-γ) enzyme-linked immunospot (ELISPOT) assays (memory T cells). The two groups were compared in the statistical model are: Randomized to Booster and Randomized to No Booster.
measure.population: Subjects received at least 1 infusion of sipuleucel-T, were randomized to receive either a booster infusion or no further treatment following RP, and had blood samples suitable for ELISPOT analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: The change over time was evaluated by using repeated measure analysis of variance (ANOVA) methods with a mixed model approach. The ranked data were used in the statistical model.
analysis.p_value_desc: P value is based on the treatment effect in the mixed model
analysis.method_desc: Mixed model includes randomization group, visit, and randomization group × visit interaction, with subject as a random effect.

outcome.title: Comparison of Booster Effect in Antigen PAP-Specific T Cell Immunity Over Time Between the Two Randomized Groups
outcome.description: The number of Antigen PAP-specific T cells was enumerated by interferon gamma (IFN-γ) enzyme-linked immunospot (ELISPOT) assays (memory T cells). The two groups were compared in the statistical model are: Randomized to Booster and Randomized to No Booster. PAP = Prostatic Acid Phosphatase.
outcome.time_frame: 12 Weeks Post-RP (Pre-booster) and up to 72 Weeks post-RP
outcome.population: Subjects received at least 1 infusion of sipuleucel-T, were randomized to receive either a booster infusion or no further treatment following RP, and had blood samples suitable for ELISPOT analysis.

group.title: No Booster: 12 Weeks Post-RP/Pre-Booster
group.description: ELISPOT for PAP measured at 12 Weeks Post-RP/Pre-Booster for subjects randomized to no booster

measure.title: Comparison of Booster Effect in Antigen PAP-Specific T Cell Immunity Over Time Between the Two Randomized Groups
measure.description: The number of Antigen PAP-specific T cells was enumerated by interferon gamma (IFN-γ) enzyme-linked immunospot (ELISPOT) assays (memory T cells). The two groups were compared in the statistical model are: Randomized to Booster and Randomized to No Booster. PAP = Prostatic Acid Phosphatase.
measure.population: Subjects received at least 1 infusion of sipuleucel-T, were randomized to receive either a booster infusion or no further treatment following RP, and had blood samples suitable for ELISPOT analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: The change over time was evaluated by using repeated measure analysis of variance (ANOVA) methods with a mixed model approach. The ranked data were used in the statistical model.
analysis.p_value_desc: P value is based on the treatment effect in the mixed model
analysis.method_desc: Mixed model includes randomization group, visit, and randomization group × visit interaction, with subject as a random effect

group.title: Sipuleucel-T With Booster
group.description: Subjects receive 3 infusions of sipuleucel-T 12 weeks prior to RP, and then received an additional booster infusion 13 weeks after RP.

group.title: Sipuleucel-T Without Booster
group.description: Subjects received 3 infusions of sipuleucel-T 12 weeks prior to RP, with no further sipuleucel-T treatment.

group.title: Sipuleucel-T Without Randomization to Booster
group.description: Subjects received 3 infusions of sipuleucel-T 12 weeks prior to RP, and declined participation in the post-RP booster phase (received no further sipuleucel-T treatment).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The results of the study will be published and/or presented in an integrated manner reflecting the results observed across all participating centers. Accordingly, decisions on timing and content of publications and presentations relating to the study will be coordinated by Dendreon in communication with institutions contributing patients to the study.
